ab.title: Leviticus 3
ab.l: And if his offering is a sacrifice of a peace offering,if he offers it from the cattle,whether male or female, he shall bring it forward unblemished before the Lord.
And he shall reach out his hand over the head of his offeringand slaughter it at the door of the tent of meeting, andAaron’s sons, the priests, shall sprinkle the blood on the altarall around.
And he shall bring forward fromthe sacrifice of the peace offering an offering by fire to the Lord: the fat thatcovers the stomach, and all the fat that ison the stomach,
And the two kidneys,and the fat that is on them, which is at the loins,and the extra of it that is above the liver:he shall take it away with the kidneys.
And Aaron’s sons shall burn it on the altarnext to the burnt offering, which is on the wood that ison the fire, an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.
And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering to the Lord is from the flock,male or female, he shall offer it unblemished.
If he brings forward a lamb for his offering,he shall bring it forward before the Lord.
Andhe shall reach out his hand over the head of his offering and slaughter itbefore the tent of meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall sprinkleits blood on the altar all around.

And he shall bring forward from the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering by fire to the Lord:its fat, and the entire |fat| tail — he shall take it away from opposite the †backbone –and the fat that covers the stomach, andall the fat that is on the stomach,
And thetwo kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which isat the loins, and the extra fat above the liver:he shall take it away with the kidneys.
And the priest shall burn it on the altar: bread, an offering by fireto the Lord.
And if his offering is a goat, thenhe shall bring it forward before the Lord.
And he shall reach outhis hand over the head of it and slaughter it before the tentof meeting, and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its bloodon the altar all around.
And he shall offerfrom it his offering, an offering by fire to the Lord: the fatthat covers the stomach, and all the fatthat is on the stomach,
And the two kidneys,and the fat that is on them, which is at the loins, and theextra fat above the liver: he shall take it away with the kidneys.
And the priest shall burn themon the altar: bread, an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance. All fat is the Lord’s.
It shall be an eternal statute throughout your generations, in all your dwellingplaces: you shall not eat any fat and any blood.

app.note: An uncertain interpretation of qysylyr orun. Probably a mistranslation of BHeb. הֶעָצֶה ‘the spine’ (a hapax legomenon, Lev 3:9); lit. ‘the place which is squeezed’. The Hebrew word could have been confused with the Heb. root עסה ‘to squeeze, to press’.
